Plastic pollution treaty talks open with 'global crisis' warning
subhead: Delegates from over 180 countries began final talks Tuesday in Geneva to craft a global treaty on plastic pollution, amid mounting pressure to curb a crisis threatening ecosystems, health, and the planet. 'The urgency is real, the evidence is clear – and the responsibility is on us,' said Ecuadorian diplomat Luis Vayas Valdivieso.

title: The calculated return of Kamala Harris after defeat and months of silence
subhead: The former vice president of the United States has announced the release of a memoir, '107 Days,' out September 23, revealing the behind-the-scenes from her presidential campaign. Harris, who appeared Thursday on Stephen Colbert's 'The Late Show' on CBS, has remained vague, however, about the future of her political involvement.
byline: By Corine Lesnes (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Legal battle erupts over inheritance of former richest man in China
subhead: Zong Qinghou, founder of the Wahaha beverage empire who died in 2024, reportedly fathered three children from an extramarital affair. These children are now contesting the late tycoon's inheritance with his legitimate daughter, who has become CEO of the company.

title: Eva Nguyen Binh, head of the Institut Français: 'Attacking culture has long-term consequences'
subhead: The president of the Institut Français, a French overseas cultural policy actor which has just had its contract renewed, discusses the challenges that cultural diplomacy faces in a time of geopolitical tensions.
